contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Belgium Municipality |name=Gembloux |picture=Gembloux JPG05.jpg |picture-legend=Gembloux town hall square and belfry |map=Gembloux Namur Belgium Map.png |map-legend=Location of Gembloux in the province of Namur |arms=Blason ville be Gembloux (Namur).svg |flag=Flag of Gembloux.svg |region={{BE-REG-WAL}} |community={{BE-FR}} |province={{BE-PROV-NM}} |arrondissement=[[Arrondissement of Namur|Namur]] |nis=92142 |pyramid-date |0-19= |20-64 |65 |foreigners= |foreigners-date |mayor=Benoît Dispa (Bailli) |majority=Bailli, [[Ecolo]] |postal-codes=5030-5032 |telephone-area=081 |web=[http://www.gembloux.be/ www.gembloux.be] |lat_deg=50 |lat_min=34 |lon_deg=04 |lon_min=41 }} '''Gembloux''' ({{IPA-fr|ʒɑ̃.blu}}; in [[Walloon language|Walloon]]: ''Djiblou''; in [[Dutch language|Dutch]]: ''Gembloers'') is a [[Wallonia|Walloon]] [[municipality]] located in the [[Belgium|Belgian]] province of [[Namur (province)|Namur]], on the axis Brussels-Namur On 1 January 2006 the municipality had 21,964 inhabitants. The total area is 95.86 km², giving a [[population density]] of 229 inhabitants per km². The mayor, who has been elected on 8 October 2006, is Benoît Dispa. This city is well known for its [[Faculté Universitaire des Sciences Agronomiques de Gembloux|Agricultural University]] and for its [[cutlery]]. The university is housed in the historical [[Gembloux Abbey|Abbey of Gembloux]], which dates from the tenth century. Gembloux's Belfry belongs to the set of [[belfries of Belgium and France]] inscribed on [[UNESCO]]'s World Heritage List in 2005. The town grew around the [[Gembloux Abbey]], founded in the tenth century. In the vicinity of the town, in 1578, the [[Battle of Gembloux]] was fought during the [[Eighty Years' War]]. In May 1940 the [[Battle of Hannut]] and the [[Battle of Gembloux (1940)|Battle of the Gembloux Gap]] took place nearby, tank battles during the larger [[Battle of France]]. == Sections == Gembloux is composed by the sections of Gembloux, Beuzet, Bossière, Bothey, Corroy-le-Château, Ernage, Grand-Leez, Grand-Manil, Isnes, Lonzée, Mazy & Sauvenière. [[Lincoln, Kewaunee County, Wisconsin]], third most [[Belgian American]] town, was originally named Grandlez, after Grand-Leez where Belgian founding migrants came from. ==Notable inhabitants== *[[Christophe Szpajdel]], sketch artist (born 1970) ==Twin towns== Gembloux is twinned with * {{flagicon|France}} - [[Épinal]], [[France]] : since 1974 * {{flagicon|UK}} - [[Loughborough]], [[United Kingdom]] : since 1993 * {{flagicon|Greece}} - [[Skyros]], [[Greece]] : since 1994 * {{flagicon|Germany}} - [[Aller]], [[Germany]] : since 2007 [[File:Gembloux JPG002.jpg|thumb|left|'''Gembloux''', University Faculty of agronomic sciences.|250px]] ==See also== * [[Crealys Science Park]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.gembloux.be/ Gembloux official site] (in French) {{Commons category|Gembloux}} {{Namur}} [[Category:Municipalities of Namur (province)]] {{Namur-geo-stub}}
